t: Lord,*spn I call to you; my*ln rock, do not be deaf to me. If*ln you remain silent to me, I*ln will be like those going down to the Pit.
Listen*ln to the sound of my pleading when*ln I cry to you for help, when*ln I lift up my hands toward*ln your holy sanctuary.
Do*pn not drag me away with the wicked, with*ln the evildoers, who*ln speak in friendly ways with their neighbors while*ln malice is in their hearts.
Repay*ln them according to what they have done — according*ln to the evil of their deeds. Repay*ln them according to the work of their hands; give*ln them back what they deserve.
Because*ln they do not consider what*ln the Lord*s has done or*ln the work of his hands, he*ln will tear them down and not rebuild them.
Blessed*pn be the Lord,*s for*ln he has heard the sound of my pleading.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my shield; my*ln heart trusts in him, and I am helped. Therefore*ln my heart celebrates, and*ln I give thanks to him with my song.
The*pn Lord*s is the strength of his people; he*ln is a stronghold of salvation for his anointed.
Save*ln your people, bless your possession, shepherd*ln them, and carry them forever.
